title: Understanding Patient-Centered Medical Homes
text: Patient-Centered Medical Homes (PCMH) are designed to provide comprehensive, coordinated, and client-centered models of primary care. They focus on integrating various health services to ensure continuous and accessible care for patients.

title: Core Elements of PCMH
text: The core elements of PCMH include clinical outreach, low threshold access to care, integrated services, sustenance needs, health-care management, and continual staff training. These elements distinguish PCMH from traditional primary care models.

hintAnswer: Clinical outreach: Outreach to people without homes, individuals in shelters, and to those in community locations, such as soup kitchens
title: Identifying Core Elements
text: Which of the following is a core element of the Patient-Centered Medical Home model?
choices: Clinical outreach: Outreach to people without homes, individuals in shelters, and to those in community locations, such as soup kitchens
Low threshold access to care: Open access with $$walk-in$$ capacity and flexible scheduling
Integrated services: Several different kinds of $$health-care$$ providers in one location
Sustenance needs: Food or food vouchers, hygiene kits, clothes, bus passes, other transportation assistance
$$Health-care$$ management: Integrated with community agencies with an emphasis on ongoing, continuous care
Continual staff training: Focusing on development of care skills for those without homes
